channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-9248] Place holders for tags in 0.96 to accommodate tags in 0.98
item.description:
This JIRA is focused on adding placeholders for tags in 0.96 so that 0.98 would be easier to accommodate tags.
Changes would be in WAL Encoders/decoders with compression.
PrefixTree codec. (Had an offline discussion with Matt Corgan on this).
If anything else would be needed I can add it in this JIRA.
item.summary: Place holders for tags in 0.96 to accommodate tags in 0.98

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Working on this. Will gave a patch by tomorrow.
What's the benefit of getting this into 0.96 vs just putting it in 0.98 ?

For RPC, we could handle the anticipated tag related issues by allowing different client and server side codecs on a connection. Changes would be needed for 0.96 if there's to be a negotiation. This is somewhat related to HBASE-9230.

Patch for place holders in WALCellCodec and PrefixTree encoder. Mainly it adds place holders in the PrefixTreeBlockMeta.
For reading files without tags using the Seeker that is with tags, we could make use of numTagBytes


+    // Read tags only if there are tags in the meta

+    if(blockMeta.getNumTagBytes() != 0) {

+      populateTag();

+    }

in PrefixTreeArrayScanner. The above check would be needed because the offset of any entity is formed from the previous entities offset and the number of bytes that it occupies.
Matt Corgan
Can you review the changes in PrefixTree? Also the number of ints were previously 22 but I think it should be more than that?
Also changes getTagsLength() to short.

+ // To support tags
+ StreamUtils.writeRawVInt32(out, kv.getTagsLength());

KV#getTagsLength Will throw UnsupportedOperationException ??

int length = KeyValue.KEYVALUE_INFRASTRUCTURE_SIZE + keylength + vlength + tagsLength;

We need 2 bytes addition to INFRASTRUCTURE_SIZE to accommodate the tags length.

KV#getTagsLength Will throw UnsupportedOperationException ??

This for now we will return 0?

We need 2 bytes addition to INFRASTRUCTURE_SIZE to accommodate the tags length.

This may not be needed for now because the taglength is going to be 0. So once tags comes in the KeyValue.INFRASTRUCTURE_SIZE can be changed that time this would get accommodated.

May be we can do like this

StreamUtils.writeRawVInt32(out, 0);

StreamUtils.readRawVarint32(in);
int length = KeyValue.KEYVALUE_INFRASTRUCTURE_SIZE + keylength + vlength
We know the tagslen will be 0. So just ignore the read value.

What do u say?

Updated patch writing 0 directly. Or we can do like this 


+      // To support Tags..Tags length will be 0

+      int tagsLength = StreamUtils.readRawVarint32(in);

+      int length = 0;

+      if (tagsLength > 0) {

+        length = KeyValue.KEYVALUE_INFRASTRUCTURE_SIZE + Bytes.SIZEOF_INT + keylength + vlength

+            + tagsLength;

+      } else {

+        length = KeyValue.KEYVALUE_INFRASTRUCTURE_SIZE + keylength + vlength;

+      }

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12598720/HBASE-9248.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 6 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop1.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 1.0 profile.

+1 hadoop2.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 2.0 profile.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

-1 site. The patch appears to cause mvn site goal to fail.

Not sure why QA did not run. All testcases passed in my local box.

Stack,Matt Corgan
Can you review this patch?

+1

Just changes tag length from int to short and then adds a 0 tags length to WALCellCodec.

Will give this a few hours in case Mighty Matt Corgan has any comment... then will commit.

Looks ok to me Ram. I've said in a few reviews I think it'd be better to refer to the tags section of a cell as plural, else when you start adding the code dealing with individual tags it will all get confusing. Doesn't seem you agree =)

Variables like PrefixTreeBlockMeta.maxTagLength -> maxTagsLength
ramkrishna.s.vasudevan I agree w/ Mr. Matt. Will wait on new patch before commit.

No Matt. I agree. If you see the bigger patches that I have in RB I have updated the name to be plural every where.
Here it was not done (i missed it because a 'max' comes before it). I will surely change this. Thanks a lot for the reviews.
Updated patch. Made plural as per Matt's suggestion.
